item.title: Ex-Network International execs raise $6M for Enza, an African fintech serving banks
item.dc:creator: Tage Kene-Okafor
item.description: Over the past decade, Dubai-based Network International has become one of the dominant payment processors across the Middle East and Africa, thanks in part to a pair of acquisitions. However, many large incumbents can fall prey to slower innovation, opening the door for smaller, faster-moving startups. The latest development is Enza, a fintech founded in […]

item.title: DNA testing company 23andMe files for bankruptcy protection, CEO resigns
item.dc:creator: Ivan Mehta
item.description: Genetics testing company 23andMe has filed for Chapter 11 bankruptcy protection in the U.S. to initiate the sale of its assets. Alongside the announcement, the company’s co-founder and CEO Anne Wojcicki separately said she is leaving the company to become an independent bidder for the company. “After a thorough evaluation of strategic alternatives, we have […]

item.title: Former Cruise CEO Kyle Vogt’s new robotics startup reportedly raises another $150M
item.dc:creator: Kirsten Korosec
item.description: The Bot Company, the robotics startup founded by former Cruise co-founder and CEO Kyle Vogt, has raised $150 million in a round led by Greenoaks, according to Reuters, citing unnamed sources. Vogt founded the startup with Paril Jain, who led the AI tech team at Tesla, and former Cruise software engineer Luke Holoubek. Vogt did […]

item.title: Buy now, pay later . . . for a burrito?
item.dc:creator: Connie Loizos
item.description: In 2010, a programmer who was mining bitcoin famously made the comically expensive mistake of spending 10,000 bitcoin on two pizzas. As of this writing, those coins would be worth $850 million dollars. While there are few comparisons to that kind of miscalculation, the prospect of adding interest payments to fast-food orders is raising concerns […]

item.title: Barack Obama joins Bluesky
item.dc:creator: Sarah Perez
item.description: Social network Bluesky, an alternative to X built on open source technologies, has scored a big win in terms of attracting notable users to its platform. The company on Sunday confirmed that former president Barack Obama has joined its service. Bluesky OOO Rose Wang replied to a post where someone wondered if the account posting […]

item.title: Browser Use, the tool making it easier for AI ‘agents’ to navigate websites, raises $17M
item.dc:creator: Ivan Mehta
item.description: We may not have an agreed-upon definition of AI “agent” yet, but a multitude of startups want to create “agentic” tools to automate various tasks online. One such firm, Browser Use, has attracted a ton of interest from developers and investors thanks to its solution that makes websites more “readable” for AI agents. Browser Use […]

item.title: Jonah Peretti helped shaped digital media — can he do it again?
item.dc:creator: Connie Loizos
item.description: Jonah Peretti’s career to date has been defined by constant reinvention. As the founder and CEO of BuzzFeed, Peretti has been at the forefront of digital media for almost two decades, navigating changes as the once small startup transformed into, at one point, a multimedia powerhouse. But as the company grows older, one question lingers: […]

item.title: Charlie Javice trial becomes a master class in hubris for both sides
item.dc:creator: Connie Loizos
item.description: Charlie Javice’s high-profile fraud trial has become a showcase of embarrassing missteps on both sides, with eyebrow-raising details about how JPMorgan Chase was allegedly deceived into buying her startup, Frank, for $175 million when it had just 300,000 customers instead of four million. Per a new WSJ article, one pivotal moment came when former Frank […]

item.title: Week in Review: Google buys Wiz
item.dc:creator: Karyne Levy
item.description: Welcome back to Week in Review! We’ve got tons of stories to share from this week, like the greatest hits from Nvidia GTC; the NASA astronauts finally came home; Rippling’s lawsuit; and Google bought Wiz. Let’s get to it! Google finally does it: Google made its biggest acquisition in its history this week when it […]

item.title: The 20 hottest open source startups of 2024
item.dc:creator: Paul Sawers
item.description: A new report showcases the 20 top-trending open source startups around the world, more than half of which are closely aligned with AI. The report is the handiwork of European venture capital firm Runa Capital, which has operated the Runa Open Source Startup (ROSS) Index since 2020. The Index serves quarterly updates on the fastest-growing […]

item.title: Meta settles UK ‘right to object to ad-tracking’ lawsuit by agreeing not to track plaintiff
item.dc:creator: Natasha Lomas
item.description: A human rights campaigner, Tanya O’Carroll, has succeeded in forcing social media giant Meta not to use her data for targeted advertising. The agreement is contained in a settlement to an individual challenge she lodged against Meta’s tracking and profiling back in 2022. O’Carroll had argued that a legal right to object to the use […]

item.title: Anduril might build a weapons factory in the UK
item.dc:creator: Charles Rollet
item.description: Anduril might build a factory in the U.K. as it expands beyond U.S. defense contracts.

item.title: Meta has revenue sharing agreements with Llama AI model hosts, filing reveals
item.dc:creator: Kyle Wiggers
item.description: In a blog post last July, Meta CEO Mark Zuckerberg said that “selling access” to Meta’s openly available Llama AI models “isn’t [Meta’s] business model.” Yet Meta does make at least some money from Llama through revenue-sharing agreements, according to a newly unredacted court filing. The filing, submitted by attorneys for the plaintiffs in the […]

item.title: How BYD plans to make EV charging as fast as filling a gas tank
item.dc:creator: Tim De Chant
item.description: What we found mostly supports the auto makers claims, with a few caveats.

item.title: Valve removes video game demo suspected of being malware
item.dc:creator: Lorenzo Franceschi-Bicchierai
item.description: Valve removed a video game called Sniper: Phantom's Resolution from Steam after users reported that its free demo contained malware.

item.title: DeepSeek: Everything you need to know about the AI chatbot app
item.dc:creator: Kyle Wiggers
item.description: DeepSeek has gone viral. Chinese AI lab DeepSeek broke into the mainstream consciousness this week after its chatbot app rose to the top of the Apple App Store charts (and Google Play, as well). DeepSeek’s AI models, which were trained using compute-efficient techniques, have led Wall Street analysts — and technologists — to question whether the U.S. can maintain its […]

item.title: TechCrunch has, yes, personal news!
item.dc:creator: Connie Loizos
item.description: If you haven’t heard the news, TechCrunch has a shiny new home. After years under the ownership of Yahoo — which, in turn, is backed by Apollo Group — the brand is now in fresh hands. Its new parent company: Regent, a dynamic private equity firm with a diverse portfolio spanning media, retail, and manufacturing. […]

item.title: Anthropic appears to be using Brave to power web search for its Claude chatbot
item.dc:creator: Kyle Wiggers
item.description: Earlier this week, Anthropic rolled out a web search feature for its AI-powered chatbot platform, Claude, bringing the bot in line with many of its rivals. It wasn’t immediately clear which search index might be powering the feature — one possibility was that Anthropic had developed its own. But evidence suggests it’s Brave Search, the […]

item.title: Startups Weekly: Wiz’s bet paid off in an M&A-rich week
item.dc:creator: Anna Heim
item.description: Welcome to Startups Weekly — your weekly recap of everything you can’t miss from the world of startups. Want it in your inbox every Friday? Sign up here. It’s rare to report on an 11-figure startup acquisition, let alone multiple high-value deals in a single week. And there are more subtle signs that things are […]

item.title: TechCrunch Mobility: Inside Waymo’s deal with SFO, Elon’s moment of truth, and BYD’s breakthrough
item.dc:creator: Kirsten Korosec
item.description: Welcome back to TechCrunch Mobility — your central hub for news and insights on the future of transportation. Sign up here for free — just click TechCrunch Mobility! Before we jump into the news, just a quick bit of housekeeping. I’m putting “This week’s wheels” on hiatus for a few weeks as I get into […]
